website_summaries.verdict: A basic steering wheel spinner option with a more streamline design and feel.
pros: Simple installation and set up with a mounting ring that pops right onto the steering wheel
Basic, flat steering knob fits most palms comfortably without feeling awkward
cons: The mounting ring can slide off since it lacks any fasteners like a bolt or screw

customer_reviews.title: Easy install (just pops right on), and makes turning super slick with just the touch of the palm.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install (just pops right on), and makes turning super slick with just the touch of the palm. UPDATE **about 2 weeks after posting this review, the corner of the silicone broke off, exposing a sharp metal edge. The edge ripped right through my pants. No idea how this happened, but very disappointing.**
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this in prep for getting rotator cuff surgery ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in prep for getting rotator cuff surgery so I'd be able to get around. Not only has it made life bearable during recovery and given me the ability to get around, I have gained a lot more confidence in using it even in some mild 4x4 situations. One start lost because the bearing in it is a bit looser, a little tighter less wiggle and it'd be a solid 5 stars. Even then, I'm probably going to keep it on my truck even when I no longer need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S. Mees

customer_reviews.title: SMOOTH OPERATOR
customer_reviews.text: This steering wheel spinner is exactly as advertised! I think it took me all of about 1 minute to install this on my steering wheel. I was a little skeptical about it staying in place with no hardware to hold it, but I wanted it to be subtle. Since this is almost all black, putting it on my black steering wheel did that and I have experienced no problems with any slipping of the spinner. I have a medical issue that makes it painful to use my left arm to steer. This device allows me to safely control the steering of my vehicle with total confidence. GREAT DEVICE!!
customer_reviews.author: ELK

customer_reviews.title: Was 5 stars until knob came off!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this knob for the first year I had it. Low profile and easy to grip. It stayed in place on the steering wheel without having to use the stick pad that was provided. The bad is that it is now broken. The knob has come off the handle and it would be unsafe to place it back on. I’d love to get another one but not sure if I’d shell out another $20. It was a 5 Star product for me until this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Bob D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for one handed driving.
customer_reviews.text: This is the flattest steering wheel spinner I could find.. It does not stick up high enough to really whop you on the wrist. If you have had some sort of surgery where you can only drive with one hand, this will work. Did not attach it permanently. Allowed the person to drive with left hand and shift the gears with right hand with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie77

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived yesterday, but I realized immediately that it is the perfect solution for getting me through my shoulder injury. Fit easily (for hubby at least) over my steering wheel and cover (Honda Odyssey van), is very secure without using the adhesive strip, and steers very comfortably with left palm. I like that it is flatter and less rigid than other modes, so will be less likely to cause injury in a car accident. I have it at the 9:30 position so I can rest my hand on the steering wheel horizontal post, right next to knob. I would definitely recommend this product; will probably keep using it after shoulder heals.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Product needs to be corrected before someone gets injured.
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after 5 weeks.Screws pulled out that hold spinner to base. I'd like company to send me a replacement or give me my money back. I'm lucky I didn't get into an accident.
customer_reviews.author: John Leshinski

customer_reviews.title: It broke!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well...it lasted 4 months and broke! So...the good news was that I was not driving...just turning the steering wheel. The bad news...it broke...simply broke off on my hand! Will not order another from this manufacturer/supplier. Question of liability and safety enters the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Norris

customer_reviews.title: For palm steering this is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Received product on time and in perfect condition. It took less than a minute to pop it on m steering wheel. Tried it on all three of my vehicles and it works great! I didn't use the enclosed tape and it works like a charm. With bad arthritis in my hands this little gem makes driving easier and safer for me. It is only for palm steering as it is not thick enough to really hang on to, just an fyi. It works so great that I bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: Hardware Guy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable & Low Profile
customer_reviews.text: I am handicap and have trouble using my right arm. I love this Steering Wheel Spinner. I clamped mine to the left-hand side of the steering wheel, just above the horizontal bar. It does not slip around. The flat knob is very comfortable against the palm. Importantly, it is very easy to transition from the steering wheel to the knob. This knob allows me to turn easily and to park (even parallel). Also, since it is low profile, it blends nicely into my black steering wheel; thus not easily visible from outside the auto (in many states it is illegal to use this device, unless you have a handicap plate or placard). I love it!
customer_reviews.author: GB46

customer_reviews.title: DIDN'T LAST TWO MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Nice, tacky rubber. Spins freely but solidly. Moved several times to find spot I preferred. Most modern-ish steering wheels won't need backing adhesive; but would come in handy on skinnier wheels. I've owned older and new model cars. Using it now on 2018 Toyota. My old 1999 Accord may have needed it, if that gives you an idea. EDIT: DID NOT LAST 2 MONTHS- SCREWS CAME UNDONE
customer_reviews.author: For Whom The Bell Tolls

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, high quality spinner.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this spinner for a couple of months so far and it works great! Really makes it easier to turn the wheel quickly in tight spaces. The color matches my dark gray interior well and the feel is soft like leather, not hard like plastic. It snaps on to my steering wheel and stays where I place it, never moving. Very comfortable to use with the palm of your hand. Quality product, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. It installed in about ten seconds and didn’t require the non-slip strip. It fits snugly and works perfectly without the optional strip. I love it so far, and if it holds up reasonably well over time, I’ll be perfectly happy. Two thumbs up! 👍 👍 ADDENDUM (added 07/04/2020): After a couple of months, the knob became slightly loose, so I took it off and added the non-slip tape strip—so far, so good. It still rates five stars in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: The spinner for you.
customer_reviews.text: This spinner works very well. It sits atop the steering wheel rather than offset to one side or the other. It is designed to be controlled by the palm of the hand rather than the fingers. The combination provides very good control. It installs in a second or two and adheres to the steering wheel well.
customer_reviews.author: Torrealta

customer_reviews.title: It broke and I can NOT get them to fullfill their own warranty
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after a couple months. Customer service said to let them know if I had any issues and that it has a one year warranty. I replied to their email saying it broke and showing pictures. For 2 weeks now all I get is a reply saying they are closed for inventory. SCAM! There no customer service and these things come unglued. BUY ANOTHER BRAND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brad G

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I loved this knob when I bought it. It installed easily, and it's compact so it doesn't get in the way or hit my wrist when it's in use. Problem is after 6 months of intermittent use, it's broken. The spinning head portion came completely off the clip and it won't stay back together. I'm very dissatisfied with my disposable spinner purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: ... a week now on a semi truck and performs good. The difference is that instead of holding it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the spinner for a week now on a semi truck and performs good. The difference is that instead of holding it like it's a ball you need to put your palm on top of it and spin it that way. Works for me. Since it is illegal on the highways because it is a semi truck the good thing is you can removed it very quickly before you enter weigh station.
customer_reviews.author: Roumen

customer_reviews.title: Easy off, easy on
customer_reviews.text: I need to use hand controls from time to time for my sciatica, leaving only one hand for steering. This spinner is great. Easy off, easy on; stays in place on my Ford Expedition steering wheel without the adhesive. Works great without any clamps on which to impale your hand. I only wish it were just a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: The steering wheel spinner works
customer_reviews.text: I have nerve damage and arthritis in my right hand and gripping the steering wheel adds to my pain. From day one after installing the spinner I love it. Installation took seconds with little effort, Driving is much easier, especially turning. I can now zip right into a parking space. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but with plenty of room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: It lasted almost two years, but there were problems. The plastic itself, or the adhesive is not very heat tolerant. I'm in Texas and the first time the car got really hot, the knob sweat some kind of oil and came off in my hand. It was easy to glue back together (could have been done with bubble gum, anything that doesn't turn to liquid when hot). With this problem, I think it's a little overpriced, but will be buying another one. It is the smallest low profile knob I've been able to find.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for a congenital like me
customer_reviews.text: I was born with one arm, so I needed a steering knob for driving. Most of the ones I looked at required difficult installation on the wheel, and sometimes they wouldn’t even fit. This product fit perfectly on my wheel and it was easy to install. Material is comfortable to hold and doesn’t burn in the sun as opposed to metal steering knobs! 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Moh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this knob works so great it saves on my arms and easy to pop off in case of a emergency. Always heard that they are illegal but I don't see how this could be a legal I used it without the tape that still stays in place on my simi steering wheel. Even bought an extra one for my pick up truck.
customer_reviews.author: bakerinstall

customer_reviews.title: Best device like this I ever used
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, Love this!! I have arthritic hands and joints and have used steering wheel knobs for years. The problem with most is that they are hard to install and require an Allen wrench or screwdriver and are difficult to install for someone who needs a knob to freakin steer!!! And leaves a permanent mark on most modern steering wheels. This one just pushes on and off and you can change the position in literally 2 seconds. Also instead of grabbing a knob which can hurt my fingers after a short time. This one I can just put my palm on. Highly recommend. I will be buying another just for back up use.
customer_reviews.author: Ranen Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Kind of small and flat but you might like that
customer_reviews.text: This spinner is larger than a doublestuff Oreo cookie but smaller than a hockey puck both in diameter and thickness. It is completely flat and rubbery which could help people who have trouble gripping as I find that simply pressing the skin of my palm to it allows me to control it. However, I much prefer a spinner that I used to have that was more like a small, rounded doorknob. This one is too small and not substantial enough for me. I want to grip it kind of like a ball and that is not possible with this one. However, for this very same reason it could be ideal for some. Just one star knocked off for personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: eveesmom

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it would feel cheap and flimsy, considering how easy it is to install and the like, but I took a chance and was PLEASANTLY SURPRISED! Glides smoothly around and around as you turn the wheel, stays put on the steering wheel, and is extremely easy to install. I have a leather-wrapped steering wheel (from the factory ('17 Honda Accord Touring)) so it's just slightly thicker than non-wrapped wheels, and this spinner fits nicely. I've only just received the spinner, so I'll update after a few days/weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: sip615

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: First, this is the perfect steering wheel knob. It requires no tools to apply to steering wheel and it is flat like a hockey puck making it virtually invisible on the wheel. What I like most is you use your palm flat against the puck to make steering in tight spots simple. If you do not grasp the puck there is absolutely no sliding on the steering wheel as some others have commented. I plan on ordering another.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: This does a poor job of staying in place on the wheel
customer_reviews.text: This does a poor job of staying in place on the wheel, and the knob will pop off every once and a while going over a bump. You can simply push it back onto the grip but still, this could cause a serious accident if you rely on it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Allowed me to drive after shoulder surgery
customer_reviews.text: I'm wearing a sling on my right arm following repair of my rotator cuff. This device lets me drive around town with my left hand only, including maneuvering into parking spaces. I'm not prepared to try freeway driving one-handed, even with this device, but I suppose the more adventuresome might not be deterred. But for me it's been so convenient to be able to run local errands without a problem during my recovery. I was even able to install it with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Ira

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I use this steering ball in a "yard goat" to move trailers around. I previously used a more heavy-duty type that took 2 wrenches to install and remove. Since I now only work the yard occasionally, I wanted something easier to install and remove. It's nice to be able to just slip this one on and off and, it stays in place perfectly. It's not a high profile as my old steering ball and its taken a little time to get used to, using it pretty much flat-handed Also, since I use it in a commercial vehicle, I don't expect it to last, but I like it enough that I will probably just buy another one when this one goes.
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: COMES OFF EASILY
customer_reviews.text: CAME OFF AS I WAS AVOIDING A TEXTING ROLLER BLADER WHO WANDERED INTO THE STREET
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: At first this lil knob seemed perfect. Just a handy, cool looking lil accessory to have for driving. Well, fast forward less than one year and it breaks off. Less than a year?? Come on. And think about this - it broke off. When? When driving of course. That is nothing to sneeze at and highly dangerous; capable of causing an accident. If you can't make a steering wheel knob truly endure the simple daily function it's intended for, then someone needs to get back to the drawing board. Totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Skuggs

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Spinner
customer_reviews.text: This spinner relieved me of my neck and shoulder pain from steering wheel turning motions. Instead of rolling my wrist and arm when making left and right turns, my hand and arm stay in a straightened position. The clip stays firmly in place on the padded (model year 2016) work truck steering wheel and I can even grab it and drive down the road without fear of it dislodging. One might have difficulty using this on an older model vehicle with a non padded steering wheel, and yes, it came with a rubber shim. I'm very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Keith

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it's the PERFECT steering wheel spinner! (2015 Toyota Tundra)
customer_reviews.text: The most perfect wheel spinner I have owned. Excellent fit on my 2015 Toyota Tundra. I also tried it on my wife's 2013 Kia Sorento and, again, it was a perfect fit. Smaller steering wheels or large, it works! You can use it pretty securely without the double-sided tape, however, for better fitment and security, use the tape that they supply. You can still remove it if needed and reapply self-supplied tape later. Very well constructed and spins easily. Comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Steering Wheel Assist for Rotator Cuff Surgery Recovery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend after using mine for almost a year. Easy to install and adjust as needed. It makes driving with the immobilizer sling on the right arm. It is so functional that I left it on although I no longer require it. It make turning the steering wheel a breeze and still give excellent control of the car. Great item and not cumbersome like the ones with screw-on clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great temporary choice!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's learning to drive in my Tacoma. I've needed a suicide knob for almost 7 years, following a life-changing car accident and it's not the easiest to install with nerve damage in my dominant arm. This great little knob is the perfect, temporary fix until she gets her license. I wouldn't use it as a permanent knob because it's just not as sturdy as my regular one and reviewers have mentioned this one snapping. It's just as comfy, though and large enough to not make your hand cramp, like some that seem to be modeled after a Pacman joystick.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi498

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Ever Used!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how easily this went on and how absolutely fantastic it performed. I've been using a wheel spinner since surgery weakened my left arm and hands down this is the very best spinner I have EVER used!! I cannot recommend it enough as it does exactly what it's advertised as doing. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L

customer_reviews.title: Does not last very long
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job well but does not last very long. So far I have ordered this knob three times and all the three knobs broke after few months of usage. I am trying to contact manufacturer to get a replacement or my money back. I am lucky that I did not got into accident when this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One handed driver review
customer_reviews.text: I have used a steering ball since I learned to drive due to a childhood amputation. This one is one that you just push into the wheel. No cutting or tools required and you “palm” it rather than hold it. By pressing it when you are palming it for use it helps keep it on. The quality is much higher than previous plastic ones I have had to buy. So far it is my favorite device I’ve used. I also liked that it came with gripping tape that is optional. I didn’t use it bc I didn’t want to mess up the leather cover and I don’t see why anyone would need it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome steering knob
customer_reviews.text: So I had a right shoulder rotator cuff surgery on August 14, 2020. Without this product I would not have been able to drive! Product is exactly as described on the website what are the things I like that set this one apart from all the others I saw was it simply spreads and slips over the steering wheel. Literally took about five seconds to install. The operation of the knob is very smooth. I would highly recommend for anyone needing a assistance with making sharp turns one-handed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for expensive cars... Won't damage steering wheels!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a spinner to fit the steering wheel for my MB GLC 300. I have horrible arthritis in my hands plus a bad shoulder. Spending hours on the road for my job is excruciating for me because I tend to grip the steering wheel. Other spinners were too small for my steering wheel and one that I found had spikes that when I tightened would damage the leather on the wheel. This spinner is PERFECT. It snaps on, Stays on. Moves easily and works extremely well. I can remove it easily to use it on a rental car if necessary. Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: joy to the world

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 3 other and I could not get them to fit even though the description said they would. This spinner is easy to install and it fits great. I was afraid that it would move because it has no screws but to my great surprise it does not move at all and works great.
customer_reviews.author: J Cipriano Lucero

customer_reviews.title: Great for the semi
customer_reviews.text: I use this on the steering wheel of a semi while doing a lot of tight maneuvering and backing every day. It makes the task much easier and safer and saves wear on my elbow and shoulder. The only issue I had was the center cap came off after a week due to insufficient adhesive but a quick smear of superglue fixed that for good. Very comfortable under the palm.
customer_reviews.author: William Bender

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: The spinner broke off the handle after ~2 months of use. It could have caused an accident. One star
customer_reviews.author: Fff305

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, East to Install, Good for Stroke Suvivora
customer_reviews.text: I tried out this product before letting my husband who had a stroke and no use of right arm use it. We both liked it and have had no issues to date. Works well and smooth grip. The biggest selling feature for me though was the no use of tools to put it on and take it off. So it’s so easy to move from car to car and when my husband isn’t driving i can take it off. However it does come in handy even for people with full use of both arms. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JerseySparkle

customer_reviews.title: It works but comes apart often.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these...One for each side of my steering wheel I have a disability and only drive with one hand. The one on the left is fine the one on the right at least twice a week comes off not off the steering wheel but the round things comes off in my hand as I’m trying to steer. It pops back in but I know it’s gonna pop out again because it does very regularly.UPDATE: I contacted Amazon and they sent me a new one. Very happy now
customer_reviews.author: Tracy shops A Lot

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later
customer_reviews.text: It's incredible to me... I've been using this for 5 years now without removal and this thing still works! I figured it's time to drop a review for it. If you're looking for a cheap, Reliable and surprisingly sturdy little driving aid, Then THIS is the one you purchase! After 5 years the only sign of wear it has is the face of the spinner has been worn down just slightly, it's hardly even noticeable though, It still spins easily and effortlessly, which to me, seeing this little rubber device, I wouldn't have expected it to have lasted this long but at this rate I think it's still got 5 more years left in it honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Stracke

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I got this so i can remove it after work. I've always used a knob in every truck I drove, I got off the road añd now I'm a yard dog and needed one that I could remove after shift because other's use my truck and are known for tearing things up. It works perfectly. Fits snug so I didn't have to use the rubber piece. Use your Palm to turn and not your fingers as instructed and it works fine
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after an injury made driving uncomfortable. I literally opened the package and installed it in the post office parking lot. I found it very easy and comfortable to use and it works exactly how I needed it to. At this time I haven't felt the need to use the anti slip tape included with it. As of this review I've been using it about a week and have zero complaints. Decent price and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: XGrunt

customer_reviews.title: It looks cool on my black steering wheel
customer_reviews.text: Had to get used to just palming rather than grabbing the knob. It looks cool on my black steering wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and remove as needed.
customer_reviews.text: The best feature is that it is easy to install and remove. Because I share my vehicle with others, this device needs to be removed when I'm not driving. It is quality material and comfortable to operate. I compared to several other devices and this one was the best design and quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: this is the best steering wheel spinner I have used. I have tried 3 others. this one does not slip and is very easy and comfortable to use. I installed it in about 20 seconds. the others took about 10 minutes, and were a little frustrating. I have been using this one for about 2 weeks and am very happy with it all around it was a little hard to see the "no slip pad" when unwrapping the package, but this was no big deal
customer_reviews.author: jojosmith

customer_reviews.title: Works in my RAV4
customer_reviews.text: I am having shoulder surgery and need to be able to drive with one hand. I bought two of these and placed them where my left hand seems to go on the steering wheel, still being able to reach the turn signal. These work fantastic, don't look gaudy and still on my steering wheel, slightly under my steering wheel cover. I even bought one for my girlfriend who had the same surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install this device and the website was accurate in saying that no tools are necessary. It is just important to figure out in advance where you would like to place the device on your steering wheel. I find that it works very well and makes turning the wheel with one hand very easy. In fact easier than I thought it would be. The grip of the device is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: yogasong

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT LITTLE SUICIDE KNOB
customer_reviews.text: I like that it grips the wheel fairly firmly, but as a truck driver backing puts extra stresses on the knob and it will swivel around the wheel a bit, but not enough to give a bad rating. It spins effortlessly and it feels well constructed therefore I highly recommend it. I hope it lasts a long time. We'll see...
customer_reviews.author: Ron G Sr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this for my uncle who drives commercial trucks and he said that he loves it said it makes steering much easier and is easy to pop on and off and stays secure in use
customer_reviews.author: Cream

customer_reviews.title: One-Armed Driving Ease
customer_reviews.text: I recently dislocated my elbow, and broke the radial bone of my left arm. It will out of commission for 6-8 weeks for recovery. I needed something to help me turn the wheel with my right arm only. My husband researched this Steering wheel spinner and it is a lifesaver. It is really simple to install, just sticky tape and the spinner and it works life a charm! My husband's even thinking of keeping on the steering wheel because it's so much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Rose Karlebach

customer_reviews.title: Flat and good for turning at low speeds
customer_reviews.text: The install is easy just clip it to your steering wheel. Didn't need the adhesive strip and is just what I needed because I broke my shoulder 3 weeks ago and had surgery 2 weeks ago. Allows turning at low speeds and it's tempting to use it during regular driving but the low profile makes that difficult so it's a bit safer. Also the low profile allows it to skim past my arm sling so that's a good outcome. Even with power assist steering with worn tires the steering is a bit tight but I just got new tires and the steering is easier. Over all a good purchase for use during my recovery from shoulder surgery however ase
customer_reviews.author: Richard J Thomas

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING and so easy to attach to steering wheel. I wish I had bought one years ago. I have arthritis in my hands and often turning the wheel was painful and difficult. I had hand surgery 6 weeks ago and bought this so I can drive during the healing process. I like it so much it will stay on always. I original purchased another brand that needed tools to install and the holes for the screws would not line up. Amazon refunded my money even though the company did not take returns.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Burger

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't have enough attachment to the steering wheel by design. You need one that clamps down and is tightened with a nut so it can deal with the torque you will put on it and not slide around. Search for "american shifter suicide knob" and you'll see what you should order instead of something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Kaneda0082

customer_reviews.title: Liked the first one so much, we bought two more
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and I are having shoulder surgery and need something which will make turning the steering wheel more comfortable and decided to try this. Making turns is much easier with the Spinner and it's size/shape keeps it "out of the way" when not using it. Didn't need to put the red tape on the steering wheel as it was a snug fit without it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cheryl J. Jent

customer_reviews.title: Surprise yourself. Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around and picked this one for the positive results, and boy were they right!! I love this thing. I have trouble with both of my shoulders and this sure does take the "pain" out of driving! I know some of these spinners are made like a ball that you hold onto, but this one is even better. You put palm down and cup it. I can't imagine another one working better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to attach and leaves no imprint on steering wheel when removed.
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a spinner for steering wheels since having on 50's cars but back then would leave grooves after removal due to attaching to plastic steering wheels.. Happy to discover your product recently that is easy to attach and doesn't leave marks on wheel when removed. I use it often especially when maneuvering into modern small parking spots in my large pickup truck. Thank you for this excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: jim n

customer_reviews.title: I'm SPUN! :)
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I did without this before I found it! This makes backing into my driveway and turns so much easier! I feel I have more control versus not having it on my steering wheel. I didn't use the sticker as I placed the knob on top of my steering wheel with a steering wheel cover in use. It has stayed firmly in place since I installed it. Easy to install and easy to take off if you WANT to remove it. As long as I have a car and drive, I will have this on my steering wheel!! Thanks for this AMAZING PRODUCT! 10/10 Def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Blissful Brit

customer_reviews.title: Great but you need read the review
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and easy to take back off again for example my 16-year-old is learning to drive and she doesn’t need it work great for two months came apart tried liquid nails to glue it came apart was five dollar bottle of rubber glue at Home Depot it’s been two months it’s probably going to hold forever still got the glue rubber glue if I need it
customer_reviews.author: Preschool review

customer_reviews.title: Never used one of these before, now I wouldn't go back!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try this out for fun. It's so simple, very easy to install, but it really packs a punch in functionality. I love the slim profile that isn't distracting or gets in the way. I just use the palm of my hand and it makes daily driving more fun. Turning the steering wheel is so effortless with this, especially for those wide turns. I want this on every car I drive!
customer_reviews.author: Manny Avila

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts, but this item is well made, easy to install and easy to get used to. One of my better investments. It even fits over my existing steering wheel cover and I didn't even need the non-slip strip that comes with it. I trailer my boat a lot and it makes backing up so much better...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found.
customer_reviews.text: Back in the day we all used these as there was no power steering and of course we wanted to steer with the left hand, for obvious reasons. Then they got outlawed. Tried these and was pleasantly surprised at how easy I could steer just usng the palm of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE FARQUHAR

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!;; ABSOLUTELY NO TOOLS NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I don't give it five stars is because I have had a different style in the past. The other spinners that I had could be gripped, but ths style is for the palm, and I just prefer the style that I can grip. This works perfectly fine, the other style is simply a personal preference. The product installed just as described. I was able to put it on with one hand, and it stays in place!
customer_reviews.author: D F Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and fits great on my van steering wheel
customer_reviews.text: I used the included tape on my steering wheel for a tighter fit. I developed bursitis in my right shoulder so I installed this wheel spinner so I could steer with just my left hand. I love it, and it is useful beyond my injury, very convenient to be able to use this to steer my big cargo van/converted to an RV.
customer_reviews.author: Quintessential

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, just pop it on. Very tight.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best spinner! I tried another brand but it did not fit. I have a Chrysler Pacifica and the steering wheel is very thick. However, what I also like about the spinner is that it is very low profile. It has made my life much easier (torn rot cuff).
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Maneuvering made easy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I lost the use of my left arm a few years ago and this really helps for maneuvering around when parking or any type of maneuvering so easy with one arm. I don’t really use it for driving so I put it on a part of the steering wheel that’s not in my way and love the fact that it’s not screwed on so it can be removed. Don’t let it fool you if you use it like it’s supposed to it won’t come off the steering wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best Wheel Spinner I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad left arm (MV accident), so use a "suicide knob" to assist in my steering. I've owned many over the past twenty years. This is the best designed, easiest to install, and most comfortable model to use that I've ever had. It's a very well thought out design and I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Cape Cod/AZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I just started using it and I love it already. This was super easy to install with no tools or fuss. I was a little nervous at first but it just makes turning so easy and you have a lot of control. Definitely use at slow speed and always be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Lei

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install on my lawn tractor - just clipped it on. Works fine, looks nice - a LOT better than the cheesy "John Deere" handles being sold on amazon! (Returned a John Deere one, obviously fake/poor quality.) I suspect this one from AutoMuko works better also!
customer_reviews.author: Exile LA

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in prep for rotator cuff surgery. I haven’t had surgery yet but have been using my spinner for a week already and I love it!! It was a challenge to put on b/c it was difficult to open it enough to clip on my steering wheel but I’m glad. It doesn’t move on the wheel at all. No need to use the glue strip for me. My arm (the non driving one)already feels better from not having to move it so much. Well made and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: PCS

customer_reviews.title: Oh Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: Happiest--I was very apprehensive about buying this model, but decided to give it a try--and it is awesome. I have a cover on my steering wheel and was not sure this would fit or be secure if it did fit. It popped on one time and has been locked-in perfect ever since. I am a big fan--helped me drive after operation on arm--AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: par15

customer_reviews.title: Best spinner I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Been using steering wheel spinners since 2010, and this is the first one I ever bought online (the ones at the auto parts store were too small). I was surprised at both the efficiency and the ease of installation. It really is as advertised, and feels great on the hand. Will definitely continue to purchase for all of my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ealy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this spinner to use on my forklift. Since it doesn't bolt to the steering wheel, I can easily remove it at the end of my shift. Knowing that the diameter of the forklift steering wheel is smaller than a standard steering wheel, I purchased a short piece of rubber tubing at the nearest home improvement store and sliced it down the middle. I put the steering wheel spinner over the rubber tubing and it stays in place. For easy "palm" turning, this spinner is perfect and just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: William Barrows

customer_reviews.title: Well made/stays in place
customer_reviews.text: I'm not allowed to use my right hand right now, so this spinner is a lifesaver. It was easy to install and it has remained in place. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is that the directions indicate that the spinner needs to be palmed, not gripped like a knob. That has taken some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, reliable,  useful.
customer_reviews.text: I love this knob, where has it been my whole life? Simple to use and move to my other vehicle. They supplied sticky tape to make it semi permanent, but I dont use it. The knob stays were I place it all day. Super comfortable. 6 stars. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: vince brown

customer_reviews.title: It makes turning so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was having shoulder surgery and I knew pulling in and out of parking spots was going to be tough with one good arm. This is a lifesaver!!! I am still recovering but will keep it on my steering wheel even after my shoulder is healed. I feel like all steering wheels should come standard with these. I love it!! It makes turning so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Glancy

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. Goes on very easily and fits snugly, but I did have to apply the double stick adhesive (After being under pressure a couple of times) to hold it tight. I am using this on a bass boat steering wheel, so I like the low profile and the way it sits on the wheel and not above or below
customer_reviews.author: class zone

customer_reviews.title: Makes 1-hand steering possible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me with driving after shoulder surgery. I practiced for 3 weeks before the surgery. Became adept at driving and parking with one hand. Been 3 weeks after surgery, no problems with driving. Worked as I had hoped it would.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Alderman

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Saved my hand!
customer_reviews.text: While it took a bit of time to get used to this device, after a few days I LOVED it and so did my left hand (which recently had some dramatic surgery which prevents me for FOREVER to grip in certain ways.) This device makes it SO much easier to back up the car and make certain turns. Thank you for a great product. Love the fact that you can easily move it (which I had to do) without any tools!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes turning easier
customer_reviews.text: The biggest (Little) problem I've had is deciding exactly where to put it! It is a snap to install and so easy to use. It sure makes those sharp turns a lot easier and more comfortable. It took a little practice to make my turning go smoothly, but it wasn't long before I felt like a pro. I'm 74 years old, and this makes it easier to deal with stiff joints,
customer_reviews.author: Seventy and counting

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to put on.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. We needed something that could help him with the steering wheel because he had a stroke awhile back and it was difficult for him to just turn the wheel if he made a right or left turn, so this is a god send. I remembered that we used them in the 50`s and 60`s so I thought why not. It made it much easier for my husband to steer the car.
customer_reviews.author: Hans S.

customer_reviews.title: This wheel knob has a low profile
customer_reviews.text: This wheel knob has a low profile, that is, it’s not a big knob but more like half a knob so it doesn’t stick out in the way if you’re driving. It’s easy to get a good grip when you need to use it. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mommosan

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install and has performed beautifully
customer_reviews.text: I was scheduled for shoulder surgery and needed this item to assist in driving without too much strain on the disabled shoulder. It was easy to install and has performed beautifully. I would have hated to be without it. During my long life I have had reason to use an item like this during several periods. This one is the best of all. It is also discreet. I would highly recommend it to others in a similar need I have now (July 2018) purchased a second one of these for our second car. I am" addicted."
customer_reviews.author: Popeye

customer_reviews.title: Should've bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I had a stroke a few months ago. Left side weakness but not paralyzed. I can now drive. It was difficult to back out of parking spaces being one handed. This completely solved my problem. I should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Fits when most others didn't
customer_reviews.text: I tried 4 other similar products that didn't fit so was delighted to find this one! It was easy to install and worked on the steering wheel of my 2007 PT cruiser. I'll be ordering another one for my Honda Ridgeline since I am recovering from shoulder surgery and need just a little extra help with parking and tight turns.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Barb

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous glue
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to install if you do not have a cover on the steering wheel. After I took the cover off it fit nicely. BUT it lasted less than 3 months before the glue melted (during the summer) and the top rubber part came off. It almost caused an accident because I was using it to turn at the time and it just popped off! This product is so dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works beyond expectations
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably easy to install and steer a vehicle with one hand. Had shoulder surgery and this will allow me to drive again while it heels. Flat disk design so much more comfortable than a ball since it allows maneuvering with palm only.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I've only have had this for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I've only have had this for a week now. I bought this steering wheel spinner because I have carpal tunnel & tinnitus in both my hands and arms, but i drive mostly with my left hand. This helps by making it easier for turning and just in general driving. It is a perfect size, it doesn't stick up or out. When my husband drives its not in the way for him. I also like the fact if I do need to move it or take it off it is easy. I have a TC Scion so it stays on nice an tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 2 weeks now, completely satisfied. Accurate description of the design nice slim profile and if your steering wheels is black this blends in really good and doesn't look like an add on. Price could be a little lower as I saw similar quality products with lesser price but different design. One less star for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Best one in Amazon & eBay!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use more than 5 similar products from Amazon & eBay. This is the best one. Comfortable, lightweight, easy installation. I have 2 different cars and all they have this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, secure truly worth it
customer_reviews.text: This spinner is lightweight, able to be put on or removed, conveniently sized and flat for the palm. If you are in need of one, use this one first. If curious about using a spinner, use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic after shoulder surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I had shoulder surgery and haven't been able to drive for 2 months. I bought this and my boyfriend installed it in less than 3 seconds and it works great!! I am totally confident driving with one arm. I have a 1991 Volvo and this fits my steering wheel great. I opted not to use the sticky tape and the spinner is secure without it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kim R.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Just drove 900 miles, FL to OH using my new steering wheel spinner. The spinner absolutely helped me and my arthritic hands get through the 2 days drive with a minimum of pain. The spinner is great for getting in and out of tight parking spots one handed. I'm getting another for my other car.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for truck drivers.
customer_reviews.text: First, I drive an 18 wheeler with a padded steering wheel. Next, this spinner is perfect for the trucking industry. Spinners on trucks are illegal in all 50 states, not a problem with this beauty. It has a spring clamp which allows you to simply force it down onto the wheel when you need it; when you've backed into your space and no longer need it- just pull it off, put it away. Spinners are illegal only on public highways, not on private property. Buy it, use it, enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: David De Rouen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one-handed driving
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my 16 yo daughter who has an obstetrical Brachial plexus injury and only uses one arm. I noticed she has difficulty turning corners when Im teaching her to drive. It came in minimal,easy- to-open packaging with an instruction sheet graphic depicting correct and incorrect hand placement. Steering wheel placement/removal is extremely easy and requires no tools. It's ultra portable for use several vehicles. The face of the "knob" is more flat than spherical with smooth non-slip feel. My daughter won't drive without it now and says "this thing is giving me life ". I may get a second one in case she loses it .
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Sseezi

product_meta.title: Steering Wheel Spinner, by AutoMuko Silicone Power Handle, steering wheel knob, Easy installation No tools required (Black)
product_meta.description:
Best Steering Wheel Spinner! 

 Are you having problems with handling your Car Steering Wheel conveniently? 

 If yes, then you should consider getting An AutoMuko Silicone Power Handle steering wheel spinner, for easy and convenient handling, of your car steering wheel. 

 

 AutoMuko Silicone Power handle is designed to help make turning and handling your car steering wheel much easier. It is manufactured from high quality silicone and ABS material, built to be very easy to install. You can set it up within minutes, without having any need for tools. AutoMuko silicone power handle features an ergonomic ball bearing designed to help lighten the turning radius and promote smooth rotation of your car steering wheel; this will allow you to steer easily and make turns conveniently, while driving. 

 The dynamic and sporty design of the accessory makes it stylish, elegant and gives it a striking attractiveness that will complement the interior of your car. Experienced drivers, beginners as well as female drivers can use AutoMuko steering wheel spinner. 

 To setup an AutoMuko silicone power handle on the steering of your car, simply decide where you want to install the power handle, open the C-ring wide up with both hands, ensure it’s a snug fit and check its stability before use. Setting up takes approximately five seconds and you’re done. It can be used for car steering wheels, as well as trucks, SUVs and mini vans. If you often find it difficult or daunting to turn your car steering wheel whenever you want to make a turn, then this unique automobile accessory is produced for you. 

 Get an AutoMuko power handle today and start enjoying a more convenient way to handle your car steering when making turns.
feature_bullets: SPORTY DESIGN: The dynamic and sporty design of this product, allows it to provide the much-needed support for controlling car steering wheels safely, conveniently and effectively.
DURABLE AND STURDY: Premium quality ABS and Silicone material were combined to make this product. These two materials are uniquely sturdy and possess high durability, fit for prolonged use.

QUICK TO SETUP: Setting up this product takes a total of five seconds. The three step installation process is super quick and requires no tools. Simply find a suitable area to place it, open the rings, affix it and you're good to go.

EASY TO USE: Unlike using other automotive car accessory, this new concept power handle is very easy to use. There are no complicated instructions on how to use this product because it is as easy as 1 2 3.

UNIVERSAL COMPOSABILITY: AutoMuko car accessory has been designed to be compatible with all types of cars and vehicles (generally). It is compatible with sedans, mini coopers, saloon cars, trucks, SUVs and mini vans.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,035 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
